cards.name: Weedle

cards.name: Beedrill
cards.text: May appear in a swarm. Flies at violent speeds, all the while stabbing with the toxic stinger on its rear.

cards.text: It agilely leaps about the jungle and uses the sharp leaves on its arms to strike its prey.

cards.name: Honedge
cards.text: If anyone dares to grab its hilt, it wraps a blue cloth around that person's arm and drains that person's life energy completely.

attacks.name: Metal Sound
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused.

cards.name: Doublade
cards.text: The complex attack patterns of its two swords are unstoppable, even for an opponent greatly accomplished at swordplay.

attacks.name: False Swipe
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, put damage counters on your opponent's Active Pokémon until its remaining HP is 10.

cards.name: Aegislash

abilities.name: Miracle Guard
abilities.text: Each of your Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.text: Apparently, it can detect the innate qualities of leadership. According to legend, whoever it recognizes is destined to become king.

attacks.name: Protect Charge
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done to this Pokémon by attacks is reduced by 20 (after applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Mr. Mime
cards.text: It is adept at conning people. It is said to be able to create walls out of thin air by miming.

attacks.name: Trick
attacks.text: Move a Pokémon Tool card attached to 1 of either player's Pokémon to another of that player's Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it. If there is no Pokémon to move the Pokémon Tool card to, this attack does nothing.

attacks.name: Lock Up
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Marill
cards.text: The tip of its tail is filled with oil that is lighter than water, so it acts as a float.

cards.name: Azumarill
cards.text: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.

attacks.name: Bubble Beam
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Paralyzed.

attacks.name: Superpower
attacks.text: You may do 30 more damage. If you do, this Pokémon does 30 damage to itself.

cards.name: Azumarill
cards.text: The bubble-like pattern on its stomach helps it camouflage itself when it's in the water.

attacks.name: Tail Rap
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dwindling Wave
attacks.text: This attack does 100 damage minus 10 damage for each damage counter on this Pokémon.

cards.name: Gardevoir-EX
cards.text: Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Life Leap
attacks.text: Heal from this Pokémon the same amount of damage you did to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Shining Wind
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, this Pokémon has no Weakness.

cards.name: M Gardevoir-EX
cards.text: Mega Evolution rule: When 1 of your Pokémon becomes a Mega Evolution Pokémon, your turn ends.,Pokémon-EX rule: When a Pokémon-EX has been Knocked Out, your opponent takes 2 Prize cards.

attacks.name: Brilliant Arrow
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage times the amount of Fairy Energy attached to all of your Pokémon.

cards.name: Kingdra
cards.text: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life forms can survive.

attacks.name: Shred
attacks.text: This attack's damage isn't affected by any effects on your opponent's Active Pokémon.

attacks.name: Twister
attacks.text: Flip 2 coins. For each heads, discard an Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon. If both of them are tails, this attack does nothing.

cards.name: Kingdra
cards.text: It stores energy by sleeping at underwater depths at which no other life-forms can survive.

attacks.name: Gather Strength
attacks.text: Search your deck for up to 4 basic Energy cards, reveal them, and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.

attacks.name: Dragon Blast
attacks.text: Discard a Water Energy and a Lightning Energy attached to this Pokémon.

cards.name: Vibrava
cards.text: It generates ultrasonic waves by violently flapping its wings. After making its prey faint, it melts the prey with acid.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Flygon

abilities.name: Sand Flap
abilities.text: Once during your turn (before your attack), you may choose either player. That player shuffles his or her hand into his or her deck and draws 4 cards.

cards.text: Known as "The Desert Spirit," this Pokémon hides in the sandstorms it causes by beating its wings.

attacks.name: Sand Tomb
attacks.text: The Defending Pokémon can't retreat during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Zigzagoon
cards.text: A Pokémon with abundant curiosity. It shows an interest in everything, so it always zigzags.

attacks.name: Sand Attack
attacks.text: If the Defending Pokémon tries to attack during your opponent's next turn, your opponent flips a coin. If tails, that attack does nothing.

cards.name: Linoone
cards.text: It charges prey at speeds over 60 mph. However, because it can only run straight, it often fails.

attacks.name: Fury Swipes
attacks.text: Flip 3 coins. This attack does 30 damage times the number of heads.

attacks.name: Dash Attack
attacks.text: This attack does 30 damage to 1 of your opponent's Benched Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Skitty
cards.text: It shows its cute side by chasing its own tail until it gets dizzy.

attacks.name: Charm
attacks.text: During your opponent's next turn, any damage done by attacks from the Defending Pokémon is reduced by 20 (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.name: Delcatty
cards.text: It is highly popular among female Trainers for its sublime fur. It does not keep a nest.

attacks.name: Replace
attacks.text: Move as many Energy attached to your Pokémon to your other Pokémon in any way you like.

attacks.name: Play Rough
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Spinda
cards.text: The chances of two Spinda having identical spot patterns is less than one in four billion.

attacks.name: Staggering Steps
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Confused. If tails, this Pokémon is now Confused.

attacks.name: Uproar
attacks.text: This attack does 10 damage to each of your opponent's Pokémon. (Don't apply Weakness and Resistance for Benched Pokémon.)

cards.name: Bidoof
cards.text: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

attacks.name: Scrunch
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, prevent all damage done to this Pokémon by attacks during your opponent's next turn.

cards.name: Bidoof
cards.text: It constantly gnaws on logs and rocks to whittle down its front teeth. It nests alongside water.

attacks.name: Drench
attacks.text: If this Pokémon has any Water Energy attached to it, this attack does 20 more damage.

cards.name: Bibarel
cards.text: It makes its nest by damming streams with bark and mud. It is known as an industrious worker.

attacks.name: Yawn
attacks.text: Your opponent's Active Pokémon is now Asleep.

attacks.name: Continuous Headbutt
attacks.text: Flip a coin until you get tails. This attack does 80 damage times the number of heads.

cards.name: Bouffalant

abilities.name: Sap Sipper
abilities.text: This Pokémon's attacks do 40 more damage to your opponent's Grass Pokémon (before applying Weakness and Resistance).

cards.text: Their fluffy fur absorbs damage, even if they strike foes with a fierce headbutt.

attacks.name: Derail
attacks.text: Discard a Special Energy attached to your opponent's Active Pokémon.

cards.name: Bunnelby
cards.text: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

attacks.name: Trip Over
attacks.text: Flip a coin. If heads, this attack does 30 more damage.

cards.name: Bunnelby
cards.text: It has ears like shovels. Digging holes strengthens its ears so much that they can sever thick roots effortlessly.

attacks.name: Burrow
attacks.text: Discard the top card of your opponent's deck.

attacks.name: Rototiller
attacks.text: Shuffle a card from your discard pile into your deck.

cards.name: Acro Bike
cards.text: Look at the top 2 cards of your deck and put 1 of them into your hand. Discard the other card.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Aggron Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Aggron-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Archie's Ace in the Hole
cards.text: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.,Put a Water Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. Then, draw 5 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Dive Ball
cards.text: Search your deck for a Water Pokémon, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Energy Retrieval
cards.text: Put 2 basic Energy cards from your discard pile into your hand.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Escape Rope
cards.text: Each player switches his or her Active Pokémon with 1 of his or her Benched Pokémon. (Your opponent switches first. If a player does not have a Benched Pokémon, he or she doesn't switch Pokémon.),You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Exp. Share
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,When your Active Pokémon is Knocked Out by damage from an opponent's attack, you may move 1 basic Energy card that was attached to that Pokémon to the Pokémon this card is attached to.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Fresh Water Set
cards.text: Heal 20 damage from each of your Pokémon.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Gardevoir Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes M Gardevoir-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Groudon Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes Primal Groudon-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Kyogre Spirit Link
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,Your turn does not end if the Pokémon this card is attached to becomes Primal Kyogre-EX.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Maxie's Hidden Ball Trick
cards.text: You can play this card only when it is the last card in your hand.,Put a Fighting Pokémon from your discard pile onto your Bench. Then, draw 5 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Professor Birch's Observations
cards.text: Shuffle your hand into your deck and flip a coin. If heads, draw 7 cards. If tails, draw 4 cards.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Rare Candy
cards.text: Choose 1 of your Basic Pokémon in play. If you have a Stage 2 card in your hand that evolves from that Pokémon, put that card on the Basic Pokémon. (This counts as evolving that Pokémon.) You can't use this card during your first turn or on a Basic Pokémon that was put into play this turn.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Repeat Ball
cards.text: Search your deck for a Pokémon with the same name as 1 of your Pokémon in play, reveal it, and put it into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Rough Seas
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may heal 30 damage from each of his or her Water Pokémon and Lightning Pokémon.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Scorched Earth
cards.text: Once during each player's turn, that player may discard a Fire or Fighting Energy card from his or her hand. If that player does so, he or she draws 2 cards.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Shrine of Memories
cards.text: Each player's evolved Pokémon can use any attack from its previous Evolutions. (That player still needs the necessary Energy to use each attack.),This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Silent Lab
cards.text: Each Basic Pokémon in play, in each player's hand, and in each player's discard pile has no Abilities.,This card stays in play when you play it. Discard this card if another Stadium card comes into play. If another card with the same name is in play, you can't play this card.

cards.name: Teammates
cards.text: You can play this card only if 1 of your Pokémon was Knocked Out during your opponent's last turn.,Search your deck for up to 2 cards and put them into your hand. Shuffle your deck afterward.,You may play only 1 Supporter card during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Weakness Policy
cards.text: Attach a Pokémon Tool to 1 of your Pokémon that doesn't already have a Pokémon Tool attached to it.,The Pokémon this card is attached to has no Weakness.,You may play as many Item cards as you like during your turn (before your attack).

cards.name: Shield Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Metal Pokémon. This card provides Metal Energy only while this card is attached to a Metal Pokémon.,The attacks of your opponent's Pokémon do 10 less damage to the Metal Pokémon this card is attached to (before applying Weakness and Resistance).,(If this card is attached to anything other than a Metal Pokémon, discard this card.)

cards.name: Wonder Energy
cards.text: This card can only be attached to Fairy Pokémon. This card provides Fairy Energy only while this card is attached to a Fairy Pokémon.,Prevent all effects of your opponent's attacks, except damage, done to the Fairy Pokémon that this card is attached to. (Existing effects are not removed.),(If this card is attached to anything other than a Fairy Pokémon, discard this card.)
